description: From Latin fornicātus, perfect passive participle to fornicor, from fornix (“arch, vault; brothel”). It was customary for courtesans of the era to wait for their customers out of the rain in arched passageways.

adjectives.description: fornicate (comparative more fornicate, superlative most fornicate)

entries.meaning: Shaped like an arch or vault; resembling a fornix.

verbs.description: fornicate (third-person singular simple present fornicates, present participle fornicating, simple past and past participle fornicated)
